msContents.summary: Receipt for a payment through the sitologi of 4 artabae of wheat to the credit of Sarpion.

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 6 lines written with the fibers. There is a second hand at the end of the last line, as the signature. All margins are visible.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 8.9 x 10.7cm. Roughly square-shaped papyrus with even margins with several large holes and gashes on the left-hand side, yet with no apparent excessive loss of writing. There is also a vertical tear on the right side.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1904, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Measured into the public granary from the produce in wheat of the past 19th year of the Aurelii Antoninus and Commodus, Caesars and lords, through the sitologoi of the district of Epi . . . in the western toparchy to Sarapion son of Charisius a deposit of 4 artabae, total 4 art. of wheat. (Signed) I, Diogenes, sitologus, have certified the 4 artabae of wheat. (Grenfell & Hunt)

listBibl.bibl: P. Oxy. 3.518 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
